item.title: About
item.author: contact@recommend.games (Recommend.Games)
item.description:
Recommend.Games

Recommend.Games strives to recommend the best board games for you. We take the user ratings from BoardGameGeek (BGG), apply some black magic, and present recommendations that suit you. Check out its own About page to learn more about the details!

If you enjoy our work, please check out the Donations page or tell your friends about us.

Analysis Paralysis

This blog takes the data we collect for Recommend.Games and tries to answer insteresting questions with them (at least we think they are interesting). Everything we do is open source including work in progress, so you can get a sneak peek at upcoming articles on GitLab. Better yet, you can contribute by fixing typos, suggesting new topics or even performing some analyses yourself!

Markus Shepherd

My name is Markus Shepherd (né Schepke) and I’m a mathematician 🧮 turned AI developer 👨‍🔬 and board game enthusiast 🎲 from 🇩🇪 Germany living in 🇫🇮 Finland with my wife 👩‍⚕️ and our daughters Stella ✨ und Luna 🌝.

I’m all over the internet, so if you want to get in touch, you have a choice of platforms where I will probably forget to respond. Please don’t take it personally. 🤷

  • BoardGameGeek
  • Twitter
  • Bluesky
  • Mastodon
  • GitLab
  • GitHub
  • LinkedIn
  • Wise
  • PayPal
  • Patreon
  • Ko-fi
  • Email

item.title: Donations
item.author: contact@recommend.games (Recommend.Games)
item.description:
Recommend.Games and Analysis Paralysis always have been and always will be 100% open source and free from paywalls, ads or tracking. If you find some value in what we’re doing and your finances allow you to support us with server costs etc, you can do so by donating through any of the links below (Wise and PayPal allow us to keep most of your donation):

  • Wise
  • PayPal
  • Patreon
  • Ko-fi
  • Liberapay
  • GitHub sponsors

If you’d rather donate to a charity of your choice, why not give some money to an organisation that promotes a more diverse, sustainable and loving world on our behalf?

Finally, you can always support us for free by sharing our content, giving feedback or contributing to our projects on GitLab.

Thank you for your support! 🙏
